meanings.definition: To incorrectly balance or distribute weight.
meanings.sent1: She was mispoising the books on the shelf, causing them to fall.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter made sure not to mispoise the ladder before climbing up.
meanings.sent3: By mispoising the ingredients, the baker accidentally created a new recipe.
meanings.sent4: The mispoised branches of the tree swayed dangerously in the wind.
meanings.sent5: Mispoising the fragile vase on the edge of the table led to a disastrous crash.

meanings.definition: To wrongly assess or judge a situation.
meanings.sent1: He was mispoising the seriousness of the problem, thinking it was minor.
meanings.sent2: The detective realized he had mispoised the suspect's alibi.
meanings.sent3: Mispoising the weather, she went out without an umbrella and got soaked.
meanings.sent4: Her mispoised expectations led to disappointment at the event.
meanings.sent5: Mispoising the distance, he ended up taking the wrong turn.

meanings.definition: To cause harm or trouble through improper actions.
meanings.sent1: The reckless driver mispoised the speed limit and got a ticket.
meanings.sent2: Mispoising the fragile package, he dropped it and broke the contents.
meanings.sent3: By mispoising the rules, he unintentionally offended his host.
meanings.sent4: Her mispoised words caused a misunderstanding between friends.
meanings.sent5: Mispoising the delicate balance, he disrupted the harmony of the group.
